alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 10 at 4:17PM MDT until May 10 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM MDT/600 PM CDT/ FOR NORTHEASTERN YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO...NORTHWESTERN CHEYENNE COUNTY IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS AND WESTERN DUNDY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN NEBRASKA... At 416 PM MDT/516 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles east of Haigler, or 17 miles west of Benkelman, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Public reported quarter size hail in Northwest Cheyenne county at 5:14pm CT/ 4:14pm MT IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northwestern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas and western Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska, including the following locations... Parks, Laird and Alvin. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT/1000 PM CDT/ for northeastern Colorado...northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
